title: 112_hr6088
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Total Repeal of the Unfair Taxes on Healthcare Act of 2012" or the "TRUTH Act of 2012". The table of contents for this Act is provided. The "Total Repeal of the Unfair Taxes on Healthcare Act of 2012" includes the repeal of various taxes related to healthcare, such as excise taxes on health plans, investment income, over-the-counter drugs, nonqualified distributions from health savings accounts, and more. The "Total Repeal of the Unfair Taxes on Healthcare Act of 2012" includes the repeal of annual fees on branded prescription drug manufacturers and health insurance providers, as well as the study and report on the repealed provisions. The "Total Repeal of the Unfair Taxes on Healthcare Act of 2012" repeals the excise tax on comprehensive health plans and the surtax on investment income. The "Total Repeal of the Unfair Taxes on Healthcare Act of 2012" eliminates the surtax on investment income by amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This change applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2012. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF DISQUALIFICATION OF EXPENSES FOR OVER-THE-COUNTER DRUGS UNDER HEALTH FLEXIBLE SPENDING ARRANGEMENTS AND HEALTH SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. SEC. 5. REPEAL OF INCREASE IN TAX ON NONQUALIFIED DISTRIBUTIONS FROM HEALTH SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to remove certain subsections related to Health Flexible Spending Arrangements, Health Reimbursement Arrangements, HSAs, and Archer MSAs, with effective dates for expenses incurred after December 31, 2010. SEC. 6. REPEAL OF LIMITATION ON HEALTH FLEXIBLE SPENDING ARRANGEMENTS UNDER CAFETERIA PLANS. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to remove the limitation on Health Flexible Spending Arrangements under cafeteria plans, effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012. SEC. 7. The threshold for itemized deduction for medical expenses is reduced from 10 percent to 7.5 percent. Conforming amendments are made to related sections. Effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012. SEC. 8. The excise tax on indoor tanning services is repealed. SEC. 8. Repeal of excise tax on indoor tanning services, effective for services performed after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 9. Repeal of individual health insurance mandate. SEC. 10. Repeal of employer health insurance mandate. Chapter 43 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing section 4980H, and related reporting requirements are repealed by striking section 6056. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Code. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended by removing certain sections and subsections. The effective dates for these amendments vary, with some applying after December 31, 2013, and others taking effect upon the enactment of the Act. SEC. 11. REPEAL OF EXCISE TAX ON MEDICAL DEVICES. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the excise tax on medical devices. Effective date is after December 31, 2012.

SEC. 12. REPEAL OF ANNUAL FEE ON BRANDED PRESCRIPTION DRUG MANUFACTURERS. Repeals the annual fee on branded prescription drug manufacturers. SEC. 12. REPEAL OF ANNUAL FEE ON BRANDED PRESCRIPTION DRUG MANUFACTURERS. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended by removing section 9008, effective for calendar years starting after December 31, 2011.
